instruments.name: Piano
instruments.description: Versatile instrument with 88 keys, capable of producing a wide range of tones and dynamics.

instruments.name: Guitar
instruments.description: Popular string instrument with a versatile range, commonly used in various genres like rock, folk, and classical.

instruments.name: Violin
instruments.description: Smallest and highest-pitched member of the violin family, known for its rich sound and expressive capabilities.

instruments.name: Drums
instruments.description: Collection of membranophone instruments producing sound by striking with sticks or hands, forming the rhythmic foundation in many genres.

instruments.name: Flute
instruments.description: Melodic instrument producing sound through the flow of air across an opening, commonly found in orchestras and ensembles.

instruments.name: Trumpet
instruments.description: Brass instrument with a bright, powerful sound, often used in orchestras, jazz bands, and various other musical settings.

instruments.name: Cello
instruments.description: Larger member of the violin family, producing deep, rich tones; commonly used in classical ensembles and solo performances.

instruments.name: Sitar
instruments.description: Traditional Indian stringed instrument with a unique resonating chamber, known for its complex tuning and intricate melodies.

instruments.name: Harmonica
instruments.description: Small, handheld wind instrument with reeds, allowing for melodies and chords to be played by exhaling and inhaling.

instruments.name: Accordion
instruments.description: Portable instrument with a keyboard and bellows, producing sound by pressing keys and expanding/contracting the bellows.

instruments.name: Banjo
instruments.description: Stringed instrument with a circular body and a distinctive twangy sound, commonly associated with bluegrass and folk music.

instruments.name: Harp
instruments.description: Elegant stringed instrument with multiple strings, producing a soothing and ethereal sound often associated with classical music.

instruments.name: Trombone
instruments.description: Brass instrument with a slide mechanism, allowing for a wide range of pitches and expressive playing, prominent in orchestras and jazz bands.

instruments.name: Djembe
instruments.description: Hand drum shaped like a large goblet, played with bare hands, producing a variety of tones; essential in West African music and global percussion ensembles.

instruments.name: Clarinet
instruments.description: Woodwind instrument with a single reed mouthpiece, known for its warm, expressive tone and versatility across classical, jazz, and other genres.

instruments.name: Xylophone
instruments.description: Percussion instrument consisting of wooden bars struck by mallets, producing bright, resonant tones; used in orchestras and various ensembles.

instruments.name: Double Bass
instruments.description: Largest and lowest-pitched member of the string family, providing the foundational bass sound in orchestras, jazz combos, and other ensembles.

instruments.name: Bagpipes
instruments.description: Traditional wind instrument with a bag, drones, and chanter, producing a distinctive sound; iconic in Scottish, Irish, and other folk traditions.

instruments.name: Oboe
instruments.description: Woodwind instrument with a double reed, known for its penetrating and expressive sound, frequently featured in orchestras and chamber music.

instruments.name: Mandolin
instruments.description: Small stringed instrument with a rounded body and double strings, producing bright tones; commonly used in folk, bluegrass, and classical genres.

instruments.name: Accordion
instruments.description: Portable instrument with a keyboard and bellows, producing sound by pressing keys and expanding/contracting the bellows.

instruments.name: Tuba
instruments.description: Large brass instrument known for its deep, resonant sound, often used in orchestras, brass bands, and classical ensembles.

instruments.name: Tabla
instruments.description: Pair of hand drums central to North Indian classical music, featuring a combination of tonal and rhythmic elements.

instruments.name: Saxophone
instruments.description: Versatile woodwind instrument with a single reed mouthpiece, widely used in jazz, classical, and popular music genres.

instruments.name: Didgeridoo
instruments.description: Traditional wind instrument of Indigenous Australians, producing a distinctive drone sound through continuous circular breathing.

instruments.name: Cymbals
instruments.description: Pair of metal discs struck together or individually, used to produce shimmering and crashing sounds in various musical contexts.

instruments.name: Harp
instruments.description: Elegant stringed instrument with multiple strings, producing a soothing and ethereal sound often associated with classical music.

instruments.name: Ukulele
instruments.description: Small, four-stringed instrument related to the guitar, known for its bright, cheerful sound and popularity in Hawaiian music.

instruments.name: Baglama
instruments.description: Stringed instrument with a long neck and pear-shaped body, essential in Turkish folk music and various Middle Eastern genres.

instruments.name: Marimba
instruments.description: Percussion instrument with wooden bars and resonators, producing a warm, resonant sound; prevalent in Latin American and contemporary music.

instruments.name: Balalaika
instruments.description: Three-stringed instrument with a triangular body, commonly used in Russian folk music.

instruments.name: Bongo
instruments.description: Pair of small drums, one larger than the other, played with the hands and fingers in Afro-Cuban and Latin music.

instruments.name: Koto
instruments.description: Traditional Japanese stringed instrument with movable bridges, producing a delicate and resonant sound.

instruments.name: Sitar
instruments.description: Plucked stringed instrument with a long neck and resonating gourd, central to North Indian classical music.

instruments.name: Guzheng
instruments.description: Chinese plucked zither with a history spanning over 2,500 years, known for its resonant sound and intricate playing techniques.

instruments.name: Caj√≥n
instruments.description: Box-shaped percussion instrument played by slapping the front or rear faces, widely used in flamenco and various musical styles.

instruments.name: Dulcimer
instruments.description: Stringed instrument with a trapezoidal or hourglass body, played by striking or plucking the strings.

instruments.name: Shakuhachi
instruments.description: Japanese end-blown flute traditionally made of bamboo, characterized by its hauntingly beautiful sound.

instruments.name: Tambourine
instruments.description: Small, handheld percussion instrument with pairs of metal jingles, played by shaking, striking, or tapping.

instruments.name: Nyckelharpa
instruments.description: Swedish stringed instrument with keys or tangents, producing a unique sound and used in traditional Scandinavian music.

instruments.name: Theremin
instruments.description: Electronic instrument controlled without physical contact, producing eerie and otherworldly sounds through hand movements.

instruments.name: Zither
instruments.description: Stringed instrument with a flat soundboard and strings stretched across it, played by strumming or plucking.

instruments.name: Tubular Bells
instruments.description: Set of tuned percussion tubes, producing a ringing and resonant sound when struck with mallets.

instruments.name: Angklung
instruments.description: Traditional bamboo instrument comprising multiple tubes, producing sounds when shaken to create melodies.

instruments.name: Oud
instruments.description: Stringed instrument with a pear-shaped body and a short neck, integral to Middle Eastern, North African, and Mediterranean music.

instruments.name: Cimbalom
instruments.description: Large, trapezoidal stringed instrument played with mallets, producing resonant and shimmering tones.

instruments.name: Jew's Harp
instruments.description: Small instrument held between the teeth and played by plucking a reed or metal tongue to produce twanging sounds.

instruments.name: Dholak
instruments.description: Two-headed drum played with hands, widely used in traditional Indian music, folk, and festive celebrations.

instruments.name: Kalimba
instruments.description: Thumb piano with metal tines mounted on a wooden board, played by plucking to produce melodic tones.

instruments.name: Kantele
instruments.description: Finnish plucked string instrument with a wooden soundboard and multiple strings, used in traditional Finnish folklore.

instruments.name: Saz
instruments.description: Long-necked lute with a deep round back, commonly used in Turkish, Azerbaijani, and Persian music traditions.

instruments.name: Charango
instruments.description: Small Andean stringed instrument, traditionally made from an armadillo shell, with five pairs of strings.

instruments.name: Pipa
instruments.description: Chinese plucked string instrument with a pear-shaped body and a history dating back over two thousand years.

instruments.name: Sitar
instruments.description: Iconic Indian stringed instrument with a resonating gourd, long neck, and a varying number of strings.

instruments.name: Hurdy-gurdy
instruments.description: String instrument with a hand-cranked wheel, producing sound as strings are bowed or struck.

instruments.name: Clavinet
instruments.description: Electric keyboard instrument known for its distinctive sound, produced by striking metal strings with small rubber-tipped hammers.

instruments.name: Sarod
instruments.description: Classical Indian stringed instrument, similar to the sitar but without frets, producing a resonant and rich tone.

instruments.name: Caj√≥n
instruments.description: Box-shaped percussion instrument played by slapping the front or rear faces, originating from Afro-Peruvian music.

instruments.name: Shamisen
instruments.description: Japanese three-stringed instrument with a long neck and a square body, used in various traditional Japanese music genres.

instruments.name: Daf
instruments.description: Circular frame drum with metal ringlets attached inside the frame, producing a rich and resonant sound.

instruments.name: Gamelan
instruments.description: Traditional ensemble of percussion instruments, primarily made up of metallophones, gongs, and drums, central to Indonesian music.

instruments.name: Bansuri
instruments.description: Bamboo flute commonly used in Indian classical music, known for its mellow and meditative sound.

instruments.name: Bagpipes
instruments.description: Wind instrument with a bag and multiple reeds, producing a continuous sound, particularly associated with Scottish and Irish traditions.

instruments.name: Dizi
instruments.description: Chinese transverse flute made of bamboo, featuring a unique buzzing membrane known as a mo.

instruments.name: Bouzouki
instruments.description: Long-necked stringed instrument with a pear-shaped body, widely used in Greek folk music and contemporary genres.

instruments.name: Koto
instruments.description: Traditional Japanese stringed instrument with 13 strings, played using finger picks to produce a delicate and resonant sound.

instruments.name: Tabla
instruments.description: Pair of drums used in North Indian classical music, consisting of a small wooden drum (dayan) and a larger metal one (bayan).

instruments.name: Accordion
instruments.description: Portable instrument with bellows and a keyboard, producing sound by pressing buttons or keys and expanding/contracting the bellows.

instruments.name: Didgeridoo
instruments.description: Traditional wind instrument of Indigenous Australians, producing a deep drone sound through continuous circular breathing.

instruments.name: Cittern
instruments.description: Stringed instrument with a flat back and wire strings, historically popular in European folk music and Renaissance compositions.
